content.eamr: ( ing-0 "6 (2 inch thick) slices French bread" )

content.text: 0) Cut a pocket in each slice of bread.
2) In a large bowl, combine the ricotta, cottage cheese and cream cheese.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "combine"@20:27 / AC
		:loc ( tool-2-0 "a large bowl"@6:18 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "the ricotta"@28:39 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "cottage cheese"@41:48 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "cream cheese"@60:72 / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 3) Add the sugar and flavoring extract and beat until smooth.
content.eamr:
( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Add"@3:6 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-4 "the sugar"@7:16 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "flavoring extract"@21:38 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
	:inform ( ac-3-1 "beat"@43:47 / AC
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-3-0 "until smooth"@48:60 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

content.text: 4) Spread the mixture evenly into each bread pocket.
5) Beat together the egg substitutes and milk.
6) Dip the slices of bread in the egg mixture.
7) Heat a nonstick pan over medium-high heat.
9) Cook the toast on each side for about 3 to 4 minutes per side until golden brown.
content.eamr:
( inst-9 / R
	:inform ( ac-9-0 "Cook"@4:8 / AC
		:ppt ( "the toast"@9:18 / FOOD )
		:mnr ( "on each side"@22:31 / OTHER )
		:duration ( dur-9-0 "3 to 4 minutes"@42:56 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-9-0 "until golden brown"@66:84 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)
